comments.body: Depending on what you are going to do with those numbers in the string and how many there are of them, there may be better ways.
Regex isn't the best tool for stuffs like this. Split the string at the comma and then select for distinct values.
they occur any number of times, i just want to remove the duplicate numbers.
What programming environment will you use ? A regex pattern only allows for detection, but you want to transform the string.
i will use apex.......can we avoid duplicates using regex????
Is that APEX, as in Oracle Application Express, or Apex, as in salesforce.com?
If you are writing that in a normal programming environment, just split with comma and remove dupes. No need in regex.

answers.body:
If all you have are numbers, this might work.
This doesn't address the viability of integers though, just characters.

\b(\d+)(?=.*?\1\b)\b

Using a backreference, it matches if a number exists downstream using a lookahead.

\b(\d+)(?=.*?\b\1\b)\b

Replace with nothing.

Formatted: 

 \b 
 ( \d+ )                       # (1)
 (?= .*? \b \1 \b )
 \b

title: Regular expression to avoid duplicate numbers separated by comma
body:
I have a string like 622,645,677,622,689,673,622.

I want to remove the duplicates from the above string.

I have tried with (\d{3},)* but the duplicates were not detected.

How should I modify the expression to avoid duplicates?
